justification: Superficial read of Team B. B is conservative and values stable, workhorse-like RBs and possession WRs; trading away Ben King (low volatility) for a committee RB (Jordan Green) and an outside WR with mid variance (Trevor Brown) conflicts with B’s preferences. It ignores B’s RB uncertainty with Alex White doubtful, making RB depth less expendable. Calling Brown a “stable veteran WR” is inaccurate. Reasoning is brief and not grounded in B’s actual priorities.
